definition: to be jealous of/fear/dread/scruple/to avoid or abstain from/to quit/to give up sth
all taboos are off (idiom); anything goes/nothing is taboo

sentences.english: Eat fat food less, no-noSmokeWine, answer to often maintain defecate unobstructed .
sentences.chinese: 少吃油腻食物，禁忌烟酒，并应经常保持大便通畅。

sentences.english: If there are no contraindications , LT should be recommended to patients.
sentences.chinese: 在无禁忌症的情况下，可推荐患者行LT。

sentences.english: Such images have contributed to the taboo against marriage between first cousins.
sentences.chinese: 这样的病态归咎于对近亲结婚禁忌的违背。

sentences.english: Asking weight of wenman is a big no-no in the world.
sentences.chinese: 在美国向一个女士询问她的年龄是一个很大的禁忌。

sentences.english: You just play the game freely and with enthusiasm and enjoy it.
sentences.chinese: 现在要的就是百无禁忌的去享受比赛。
打破禁忌的反应是明确的。

sentences.english: Taking preventive action beforehand and remedial action afterwards are the two common methods of warding off taboos.
sentences.chinese: 事前设防和事后补救是禳解禁忌的两种常用的方法。

sentences.english: One day we had a picnic there together, in defiance of caste rules.
sentences.chinese: 有一天我们不顾种姓的禁忌在这别墅里共享野餐。

sentences.english: There also are few maternal contraindications to breastfeeding.
sentences.chinese: 也有一些母亲原因的母乳禁忌症。

sentences.english: Eating human flesh is a taboo in civilized countries.
sentences.chinese: 在文明国家，吃人肉是一种禁忌。

sentences.english: Chirac told the Barre, you can ask any question, there is no taboo.
sentences.chinese: 希拉克告诉巴雷，可以问任何问题，没有什么禁忌。

sentences.english: Direct criticism of leaders is still virtually taboo in China.
sentences.chinese: 在中国，直接批评领导人实际上依然是禁忌。

sentences.english: We lay aside our usual inhibitions and join them in the fun.
sentences.chinese: 我们抛弃了平常的禁忌，同他们一起玩耍起来。

sentences.english: The authors concluded that fasciotomy was usually contraindicated.
sentences.chinese: 作者认为筋膜切开术常为禁忌症。

sentences.english: Condoms are a big no-no; they’re bad for business.
sentences.chinese: 安全套是一个最大的禁忌，因为不利于他们的生意。

sentences.english: However, the technicalities of the cadaver trade somewhat skirt this taboo.
sentences.chinese: 然而，尸体贸易几乎触及禁忌的边缘。

definition: to be jealous of/fear/dread/scruple/to avoid or abstain from/to quit/to give up sth
mistaken ideas/misconceptions/the error of one's ways
